meanings.definition: A person who works in the construction industry, specifically in digging or excavating.
meanings.sent1: The tarriers were busy digging the foundation for the new building.
meanings.sent2: The group of tarriers worked together to excavate the site efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The tarriers joked that they were like moles, always underground.
meanings.sent4: The tarriers were like human shovels, tirelessly moving earth.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tarriers covered in dirt stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A group of workers who dig or excavate.
meanings.sent1: We watched the tarriers dig a deep trench for the pipes.
meanings.sent2: The tarriers used their shovels to move the soil quickly.
meanings.sent3: The tarriers raced each other in the excavation pit for fun.
meanings.sent4: The tarriers resembled ants, working together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the tarriers' shovels echoed through the construction site.

meanings.definition: To delay or be slow in progress.
meanings.sent1: Don't tarriers the project by procrastinating on your tasks.
meanings.sent2: The team tarriersed the completion of the bridge by taking too many breaks.
meanings.sent3: The student tarriersed doing their homework until the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam tarriersed our journey to the beach.
meanings.sent5: His indecisiveness tarriersed the decision-making process.
